chargeHist.descr: Use a Computer to Facilitate a Child Sex Crime
Use a Computer to Facilitate a Child Sex Crime

result.execSummary:
The defendant Derrick S Statham was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Child Enticement-Sexual Contact, a class D felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.07(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

superMiscConds.notes: Costs to be paid from prison wages and/or to be paid as a condition of extended supervision.

Compliance with the Sex Offender Registry for 15 years; No contact with any minor under the age of 18 without prior approval of the Agent; No use of computers or other technological device or equipment with internet access without prior approval of the Agent;  Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.
**1/9/20: PER COURT, WHILE INCARCERATED, DEFENDANT MAY HAVE VISITS FROM HIS CHILDREN. THE PROHIBITION ON CONTACT WITH MINOR CHILDREN (WITH THE APPROVAL OF AN AGENT) COMMENCES ON EXTENDED SUPERVISION.**

  If Probation/Extended Supervision is revoked and/or a prison term ordered, outstanding financial obligations shall be collected pursuant to statutory provisions, including deductions from inmate prison monies.  If discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collections may include income assignment.

Court orders Count 2 dismissed and read in; Case 2019CF339 is dismissed and read in to this matter.

**06/05/2020 CASE 19CF0339 WAS DISMISSED AND READ-IN; THE NO CONTACT ORDER IN THAT CASE IS CLEARLY MOOT AND SHOULD NOT BE USED TO PREVENT VISITS BETWEEN DEFENDANT AND HIS MINOR CHILDREN AND THEIR MOTHER.

COMMENCES ON EXTENDED SUPERVISION.**

  Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.
  If Probation/Extended Supervision is revoked and/or a prison term ordered, outstanding financial obligations shall be collected pursuant to statutory provisions, including deductions from inmate prison monies.  If discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collections may include income assignment.

10:32 AM Defendant Derrick S Statham in court, in custody at Fox Lake Correctional, with attorney Jeffrey William Jensen.   Randy P. Sitzberger appeared by Zoom video for the State of Wisconsin.  Derrick S Statham appeared by Zoom video means with Attorney who also appeared by Zoom video.  The parties agreed to have the hearing conducted remotely under the Standing COVID-19 Order requirements. This hearing has met the statutory standards for video conferencing.  Victim rights have been complied with by the Waukesha County District Attorneys Office.  Court reviews the case on the record and notes that back on 05/26/2020 the Court granted Defendant's postconviction motion for resentencing.  Court notes it has received several character letters and has reviewed them prior to today's hearing, and questions counsel if there was anything else that was to be reviewed.  Atty. Jensen advises there is nothing else to be reviews.  Atty. Sitzberger advises there is nothing else to be reviewed.  Atty. Sitzberger presents his recommendations for sentencing.  Atty. Jensen presents his recommendations for sentencing.  Defendant presents statements.  The Defendant was sentenced to the following:

COUNT 1:

IMPOSED SENTENCE of: 

8 YEARS IMPRISONMENT (CREDIT - 667 Days):
 -  2 YEARS & 10 MONTHS OF INITIAL CONFINEMENT
 -  5 YEARS & 2 MONTHS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION;

Defendant is not eligible for Challenge Incarceration Program.
Defendant is not eligible for Substance Abuse Program.

CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION:  
Compliance with the Sex offender registry for 15 years.
No contact with any minor under the age of 18 without prior approval of the Agent.
No use of computers or other technological device or equipment with internet access without prior appoval of the Agent.
**AS ORDERED BACK ON 1/9/20: PER COURT, WHILE INCARCERATED,DEFENDANT MAY HAVE VISITS FROM HIS CHILDREN.THE PROHIBITION ON CONTACT WITH MINOR CHILDREN (WITH THE APPROVAL OF AN AGENT)
COMMENCES ON EXTENDED SUPERVISION.**
**AS ORDERED BACK ON 6/5/2020 CASE 19CF0339 WAS DISMISSED ANDREAD-IN; THE NO CONTACT ORDER IN THAT CASE IS CLEARLY MOOT AND SHOULD NOT BE USED TO PREVENT VISITS BETWEEN DEFENDANT AND HIS MINOR CHILDREN AND THEIR MOTHER.**

COURT COSTS:  $268.00 (to be paid from prison wages and/or to be paid as a condition of extended supervision);

DNA SURCHARGE:  $250.00 (to be paid from prison wages and/or to be paid as a condition of extended supervision);
Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.

Felony warnings, voting rights and firearms warnings given.

Character letter from M. Siegel filed on behalf of the defendant.  Pursuant to the Supreme Courts Order issued 4/13/2020, this document is deemed filed 07/06/2020 because that is the date it was mailed.

Character letter from Gabrielle Myhre filed on behalf of the defendant.    Pursuant to the Supreme Courts Order issued 4/13/2020, this document is deemed filed 07/02/2020 because that is the date it was mailed.

Character letter from Saundra Kachikis filed on behalf of the defendant.  Pursuant to the Supreme Courts Order issued 4/13/2020, this document is deemed filed 07/02/2020 because that is the date it was mailed.

Dated 06/23/2020 filed by Atty. Jensen requesting permission to have both his client and himself appear by video for the sentencing.  **Reviewed by the Court on 06/23/2020 - Request for defense counsel and the defendant to appear by video granted.**

Order Granting Postconviction Motion - declined
  Judges notes:  The Court signed an alternate version of this Order
Order Granting Postconviction Motion Signed by Judge Maria S. Lazar on 6/1/2020
Proposed order granting postconvcition motion submitted by Atty. Jensen.
Sentencing hearing on July 13, 2020 at 10:30 am.

11:20 AM Defendant Derrick S Statham in court, in custody at Fox Lake Correctional, with attorney Mark A. Brellenthin.   Randy P. Sitzberger appeared by Zoom video for the State of Wisconsin.  Derrick S Statham appeared by Zoom video means with Attorney who also appeared by Zoom video.  The parties agreed to have the hearing conducted remotely under the Standing COVID-19 Order requirements. This hearing has met the statutory standards for video conferencing.  Case called for oral ruling on Defendant's Postconviction Motion.  Court also notes it needs to address Defendant's Motion to Suspend Court Fees Until Release as well as a letter filed by the defendant back on 02/04/2020.  Court will first address the defendant's letter filed on 02/04/2020 and notes that it should have been resolved by the amended JOC that was signed back in January.  Defendant advises that he is still having issues with getting visits with Ms. Myhre.  The Court finds that as 19CF339 was dismissed and read into this case and therefore closed the no contact order in that case with Ms. Myhre is now moot.  Court will prepare an order to that effect to make sure that the defendant is able to have visits with Ms. Myhre.  Court will next address Defendant's Motion to Suspend Court Fees Until Release.  For reasons placed on the record the Court denies the motion to suspend court fees until release.  Court will next address Defendant's Postconviction Motion.  Court places its findings on the record.  For reasons placed on the record the Court grants Defendant's Postconviction Motion.  Court will order the defendant entitled to a resentencing hearing.  Court will schedule the matter for sentencing in mid July.  Court will schedule the matter as a video appearance by the defendant, from Fox Lake Correctional, for the next court date; defense counsel to advise the court no later than 2 weeks before the next court date if they want the defendnat produced and to appear in person.  Atty. Jensen to prepare and file an order from the hearing today.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for 07/13/2020 at 10:30 a.m.
Defendant's Reply Brief on Postconviction Motion filed by Atty. Jensen.

09:20 AM Defendant Derrick S Statham in court with attorney Mark A. Brellenthin.  Brian J. Juech appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Atty. Juech advises he has filed an amended informtion.  Atty. Brellenthin acknowledges receipt, waives reading and enters not guilty plea.  State presents the offer.  Atty. Brellenthin confirms the offer as placed on the record.  Court conducts plea colloquy wtih the defendant.  Defendant enters a plea of no contest to Count 1,  Court finds defendant guilty.  Court orders Count 2 dismissed and read in.  Court also orders case 2019CF339 dismissed and read into this case.  Atty. Juech presents his recommendations for sentencing.  Atty. Brellenthin presents his recommendations for sentencing.  Defendant presents statements.  The Defendant was sentenced to the following:

COUNT 1:

8 YEARS IMPRISONMENT (CREDIT - 305 Days)
  -  5 YEARS OF INITIAL CONFINEMENT
  -  3 YEARS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION;

Defendant is eligible for Challenge Incarceration Program.
Defendant is not eligible for Substance Abuse Program.

CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION:  
Compliance with the Sex offender registry for 15 years.
No contact with any minor under the age of 18 without prior approval of the Agent.
No use of computers or other technological device or equipment with internet access without prior appoval of the Agent.

COURT COSTS:  $268.00 (to be paid from prison wages and/or to be paid as a condition of extended supervision);

DNA SURCHARGE:  $250.00 (to be paid from prison wages and/or to be paid as a condition of extended supervision);
Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.

Felony warnings, voting rights and firearms warnings given.

02:42 PM Defendant Derrick S Statham in court with attorney Mark A. Brellenthin.  Lindsey Hirt appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court notes that due to medical conditions the defendant is under prescribed medications.  Defendant presents statements.  Atty. Court will take the request and statements made under advisement and address at the next court date.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for July 17, 2019 at 08:15 am.

11:22 AM Defendant Derrick S Statham in court with attorney Mark A. Brellenthin.  Michele W. Hulgaard appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court notes that the matter was set for plea and sentencing today.  Atty. Brellenthin presents statements and is requesting a short adjournment for plea and sentencing.  Atty. Hulgaard is in agreement to adjourn but notes that the court was suppose to also address the bail poster's request to have the bail money refunded to her.  Gabrielle Myhre appears and presents statements with regards to bail; she is requesting it be refunded to her today.  Court presents its recommendations with regards to bail.  State is agreeable to the court's recommendations for bail.  Atty. Brellenthin is agreeable to the court's recommendations.  Court will order that the cash bail be refunded to the poster and will modify bail to a signature bond.  Court notes a specific condition with regards to bail and the defendant's children.  Atty. Brellenthin presents statements.  Defendant presents statements.  Ms. Myhre presents statements.  Court sets conditions of bail.  Court will adjourn for plea and sentencing.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for April 17, 2019 at 09:00 am.
Letter from poster requesting bail money be returned.  **To be addressed by the Court on 3/18/19.**
